alert.note: Alert for Hardin; Nelson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 19 at 7:13PM EST until further notice by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kentucky... Rolling Fork River near Boston affecting Hardin and Nelson Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rolling Fork River near Boston. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 35.0 feet, Agricultural bottomland is covered. At 40.0 feet, Water begins to cross low spots on some county roads. Some homes in flood plain are cutoff. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 PM EST Saturday the stage was 38.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:30 PM EST Saturday was 38.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late Monday morning and continue falling to 10.4 feet early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 35.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 40.6 feet on 02/26/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio and your local media for the latest information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning.
